chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: (2 <= b_nat)%nat
b: Z
Hb: 2 <= b
v: nat
u: nat

Goal:
(v <= u)%nat -> A (u - v) = MU22 Z.add Z.mul (A u) (iA v)

Premises:
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
A = fun n : nat => (α (2 + n), - α (1 + n), α (1 + n), - α n) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments A _%nat_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
MU22 : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> M22 R -> M22 R -> M22 R
iA = fun n : nat => (- α n, α (1 + n), - α (1 + n), α (2 + n)) : nat -> Z * Z * Z * Z Arguments iA _%nat_scope
A_mult : forall u v : nat, A (u * v) = MZ_expo u (A v)
Z2Zp_plus : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (u v : Z), Z2Zp Hp (u + v) = Zp_plus Hp (Z2Zp Hp u) (Z2Zp Hp v)
Z2Zp_minus : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (u v : Z), Z2Zp Hp (u - v) = Zp_plus Hp (Z2Zp Hp u) (Zp_opp Hp (Z2Zp Hp v))
A_plus : forall u v : nat, A (u + v) = A u ⊠ A v
Z.add_carry_bits_aux : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> forall (a b : Z) (c0 : bool), - 2 ^ n <= a < 2 ^ n -> - 2 ^ n <= b < 2 ^ n -> exists c : Z, a + b + Z.b2z c0 = Z.lxor (Z.lxor a b) c /\ c / 2 = Z.lor (Z.land a b) (Z.land c (Z.lor a b)) /\ Z.testbit c 0 = c0
base_p : forall p : nat, (2 <= p)%nat -> nat -> list nat
Z.le_ind : forall A : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : Z, A n -> (forall m : Z, n <= m -> A m -> A (Z.succ m)) -> forall m : Z, n <= m -> A m
Zr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp eq (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe2
Zp_repr_interval : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (a b u : Z), Z.of_nat p <= b - a -> {v : Z | Z2Zp Hp u = Z2Zp Hp v /\ a <= v < b}
Z.le_antisymm : forall n m : Z, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
Z.mul_le_mono_nonneg : forall n m p q : Z, 0 <= n -> n <= m -> 0 <= p -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
alpha_2 : b = 2 -> forall n : nat, α n = Z.of_nat n - 1
Z2Nat.inj_le : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> n <= m < -> (Z.to_nat n <= Z.to_nat m)%nat
Z.mul_nonpos_nonneg : forall n m : Z, n <= 0 -> 0 <= m -> n * m <= 0
Z.mul_nonneg_nonneg : forall n m : Z, 0 <= n -> 0 <= m -> 0 <= n * m
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (p <= q)%nat -> (n * p <= m * q)%nat
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> (p <= q)%nat -> (n + p <= m + q)%nat
Z.div_unique : forall a b q r : Z, 0 <= r < b \/ b < r <= 0 -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
A_plus_mult : forall m n k l : nat, m = (n + l * k)%nat -> A m = A n ⊠ MZ_expo l (A k)
proj1_sig : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
MZ_det_B = let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := (b :: nil)%list in Zr_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) (Ring_polynom.PEc 0)) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1)) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1) I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) (Ring_polynom.PEc 0)) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1))) (Ring_polynom...
iB_i = M22_equal (let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := (b :: nil)%list in Zr_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1)) (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEc 1) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1))) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1) I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEc 0) (Ring_pol...
B_iB = M22_equal (let hyp_list := nil in let fv_list := (b :: nil)%list in Zr_ring_lemma1 ring_subst_niter fv_list hyp_list (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) (Ring_polynom.PEc 0)) (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEc (-1)) (Ring_polynom.PEc (-1)))) (Ring_polynom.PEc 1) I (eq_refl <: (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem hyp_list in Ring_polynom.Peq Zeq_bool (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem ring_subst_niter lmp (Ring_polynom.PEadd (Ring_polynom.PEmul (Ring_polynom.PEX Z 1) (Ring...
M22_mult_distr_l : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (PL22 Rplus y u) = PL22 Rplus (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) (MU22 Rplus Rmult x u)
inj_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> Z.of_nat n <= Z.of_nat m
Z2Zp_repr_canon : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0%nat) (u : Z), {v : Z | Z2Zp Hp u = Z2Zp Hp v /\ 0 <= v < Z.of_nat p}
Inductive t (A : Type) : Type := Empty : VarMap.t A | Elt : A -> VarMap.t A | Branch : VarMap.t A -> A -> VarMap.t A -> VarMap.t A Arguments VarMap.t _%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Empty {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Elt {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Branch {A}%type_scope
M22mult_assoc : forall (R : Type) (Rzero Rone : R) (Rplus Rmult Rminus : R -> R -> R) (Ropp : R -> R), ring_theory Rzero Rone Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq -> forall x y u : M22 R, MU22 Rplus Rmult x (MU22 Rplus Rmult y u) = MU22 Rplus Rmult (MU22 Rplus Rmult x y) u
Z2Nat.id : forall n : Z, 0 <= n -> Z.of_nat (Z.to_nat n) = n
Z.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : Z, 0 < b -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
